```{r}
letterwinners <- read_excel("~/Library/Mobile Documents/com~apple~CloudDocs/Harvard/GOV1005 /Milestone_4/alum_data/WLAX_LETTERWINNER_DATA.xlsx")

alumnae <- read_excel("~/Library/Mobile Documents/com~apple~CloudDocs/Harvard/GOV1005 /Milestone_4/alum_data/FoHL_ALumnae_List_10.3.19.xls")
```

```{r}
#I cleaned letterwinners data and then filtered to exclude NA values in concentration column. I then selected concentration and industry to see the data next to each other.
letterwinners%>% 
  clean_names() %>% 
  #subset(select = -x6) %>% 
  #subset(select = -x11) %>% 
  filter(concentration != "NA") %>% 
         #industry != "NA",
         #linked_in != "NA",
         #concentration != "NA",
         #secondary_concentration != "NA") %>% 
  select(concentration, industry)

letterwinners %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = "concentration")) +
    geom_histogram()

```
